message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Minimal Sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication. It is also known as anxiolysis and is typically used for minor procedures in dental offices or outpatient settings. Deep sedation, regional anesthesia, and epidural anesthesia all involve more extensive types of anesthesia and are not typically used for dental procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only minimal sedation uses solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication. The other options require more invasive methods such as injections or catheters.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Minimal Sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication, which is commonly used for dental procedures to help reduce anxiety and discomfort in patients. Epidural anesthesia, Deep sedation, and Regional anesthesia are not used for dental procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only minimal sedation uses solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication, and is used for patients who are anxious but do not require pain relief or loss of consciousness during the procedure. Epidural anesthesia involves injecting drugs through a catheter placed in the epidural space, deep sedation involves drugs that cause a patient to be asleep but still able to breathe on their own, and regional anesthesia involves blocking nerves in a specific area of the body.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Minimal sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication. It involves a minimal level of sedation where the patient remains awake and responsive throughout the procedure. Deep sedation involves a higher level of sedation where the patient is very sleepy or may even be unconscious, and requires airway management. Regional anesthesia involves injecting local anesthetic near the nerves to numb a specific area of the body. Epidural anesthesia is a form of regional anesthesia commonly used for labor and delivery.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only minimal sedation uses oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication for pain management. Epidural anesthesia, deep sedation, and regional anesthesia utilize different forms of medication or techniques for anesthesia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Minimal Sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication to keep the patient calm and relaxed. It is used for minor procedures such as dental work. Epidural anesthesia, Deep Sedation, and Regional Anesthesia are not used for dental procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Minimal Sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication, which is used to reduce the patient's anxiety and make the dental procedure more comfortable. Epidural, Deep, and Regional anesthesia are not typically used for dental procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on anesthesia for help. Minimal sedation is a type of anesthesia that utilizes only an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication to reduce anxiety and enhance relaxation. This is the type of sedation that is most appropriate for a patient who is nervous about dental procedures. Epidural anesthesia, deep sedation, and regional anesthesia are not typically used for dental procedures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options listed, only minimal sedation utilizes solely an oral or intravenous anti-anxiety medication. This type of sedation is used to reduce anxiety but does not impair cognitive or physical function. Epidural anesthesia, deep sedation, and regional anesthesia are all more invasive forms of anesthesia that require injections or catheters.
